subject: Re: [junit] Eclipse + Ant + JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Are you using the CLASSPATH environment variable for your code and tests? If so, don t. Instead, use the  element inside the various Ant tasks
messageBody:
Alistair A. Israel wrote:

> What I've noticed is that when I run the test targets in Eclipse, the
> System property "java.class.path" is missing a couple of directories,
> most notably, my project's ${build} directory.

Are you using the CLASSPATH environment variable for your code and
tests? If so, don't. Instead, use the <classpath> element inside the
various Ant tasks (<javac>, <java>, <junit>). When you use global
variables (like environment variables) for class path information, the
result is a non-portable Java environment: it makes assumptions that
other environments (like Ant under Eclipse) don't allow you to make.
